Class Rules

java.lang.Object
game.core.Rules
public final class Rules extends Object
Utility class containing static methods to validate moves and enforce game rules.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Modifier
    Constructor
    Description

  • Method Details

    • validCell

      public static boolean validCell(Board b, int row, int col)
      Checks whether the specified cell coordinates are within the board boundaries. In Hex, all cells within the n√ón grid are valid playable positions.
      Parameters:
      b - the board to check against
      row - the row coordinate to validate
      col - the column coordinate to validate
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates are within the board bounds, false otherwise

    • validMove

      public static boolean validMove(Board b, int row, int col)
      Checks whether a move to the specified cell is legal. A move is valid if the cell is within bounds and currently empty.
      Parameters:
      b - the board to check against
      row - the row coordinate of the proposed move
      col - the column coordinate of the proposed move
      Returns:
      true if the move is legal (in bounds and cell is empty), false otherwise

    • pieRuleAvailable

      public static boolean pieRuleAvailable(int plyCount, Player toMove)
      Determines whether the pie rule (swap rule) is available for the current player.

      The pie rule is a fairness mechanism in Hex that allows the second player to choose to swap colors after the first player's opening move. This method can be used to implement this optional rule.

      Parameters:
      plyCount - the number of moves (plies) that have been played
      toMove - the player whose turn it is
      Returns:
      true if the pie rule is available (typically only after the first move), false otherwise
